alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 1:19PM EST until January 14 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Essex County in northern New York... Southern Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... West central Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... Southwestern Orleans County in northeastern Vermont... Central Addison County in central Vermont... Southeastern Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... North central Rutland County in southern Vermont... Western Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 200 PM EST. * At 118 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Smugglers Notch to Black Point, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions with near zero visibility associated with intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 56 and 73. Locations impacted include... Middlebury, Morrisville, Cornwall, Sudbury, Weybridge, Salisbury, Waterbury Village, Lincoln, Orwell, Hyde Park, Whiting, New Haven, Worcester, Middlesex, Shoreham, Ripton, Morrisville Village, Moretown, Starksboro, and Leicester. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
